parameters.definition: Percentage of cat paw snacks in the first snack mix
Percentage of gold shark snacks in the first snack mix

Percentage of gold shark snacks in the second snack mix

description: Super Shop sells cat paw snacks and gold shark snacks in bulk. It plans to sell them into two snack mix products. The first mix contains \param{PctCatPawFirst}% cat paw snacks and \param{PctGoldSharkFirst}% gold shark snacks. The second mix contains \param{PctCatPawSecond}% cat paw snacks and \param{PctGoldSharkSecond}% gold shark snacks. The store has on hand \param{TotalCatPaw} kg of cat paw snacks and \param{TotalGoldShark} kg of gold shark snacks. If the profit per kg of the first mix is $\param{ProfitFirstMix} and the profit per kg of the second mix is $\param{ProfitSecondMix}, how many kg of each should be prepared to maximize profit?
